title: How to Change Your WhatsApp Ringtone for Calls and Messages

steps.title: Open WhatsApp and tap the ⋮ icon on the top-right.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp and tap the ⋮ icon on the top-right. This button is in the upper-right corner of your screen. It will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Settings on the menu.
steps.content: Tap Settings on the menu. This is the last option at the bottom of the drop-down menu. It will open your Settings menu on a new page.

steps.title: Tap Notifications in Settings.
steps.content: Tap Notifications in Settings. This will open your notification, vibration, pop-up, and ringtone options.

steps.title: Tap Ringtone under "Calls.
steps.content: Tap Ringtone under "Calls. " This will open a list of all your ringtone options in a new pop-up window.

steps.title: Tap a ringtone to select it.
steps.content: Tap a ringtone to select it. You can tap any ringtone on the list to hear a preview.

steps.title: Tap OK on the bottom-right.
steps.content: Tap OK on the bottom-right. This will confirm your new ringtone. You will hear this ringtone when you receive a voice call on WhatsApp.

steps.title: Open WhatsApp and navigate to the group or contact you want to edit.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp and navigate to the group or contact you want to edit. On Android, you can change the ringtone for specific contacts within the app.

steps.title: Tap the group or contact name.
steps.content: Tap the group or contact name. This will open some options for that contact.

steps.title: Tap Notifications.
steps.content: Tap Notifications . This will allow you to change the notification sounds for the chosen group or contact.

steps.title: Choose what notification tone you want to change.
steps.content: Choose what notification tone you want to change. There are two options: Message notifications: Tap Notification , then choose a new tone and click Save or Apply . Call notifications: Tap Ringtone , then choose a new tone and click Save or Apply . Group calls use a different ringtone that cannot be changed. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open WhatsApp and tap on a contact's name.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp and tap on a contact's name. WhatsApp contacts can have individual ringtones set on an iPhone. If you're on iOS 16.2 or newer, you can change the ringtone within the WhatsApp app.

steps.title: Tap Wallpaper & Sound > Alert Tone.
steps.content: Tap Wallpaper & Sound > Alert Tone . This will allow you to change the ringtone for that contact.

steps.title: Choose an alert tone.
steps.content: Choose an alert tone. Once you're done, tap Save to save your choices. Group calls have a special ringtone set by WhatsApp that can't be changed. If you want to change your message or group notifications, tap Settings in WhatsApp, then tap Notifications. Tap Sound under "Message notifications" or "Group notifications" to change the ringtone. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the iPhone contacts app.
steps.content: Open the iPhone contacts app. In iOS 12, WhatsApp will use your contacts' ringtones due to third-party call integration. As of May 5, 2025, WhatsApp is only supported on iOS 15.1 and later. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a contact.
steps.content: Choose a contact. You may need to scroll to find the one you want, or use the search bar at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . It's in the upper-right corner when you're looking at a contact.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Ringtone.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Ringtone . If you haven't set a ringtone for that contact, it will say "Default."

steps.title: Choose a ringtone.
steps.content: Choose a ringtone. Once you've selected the ringtone you want to use, tap Done . Group calls have a special ringtone set by WhatsApp that can't be changed. If you want to change your message or group notifications, tap Settings in WhatsApp, then tap Notifications. Tap Sound under "Message notifications" or "Group notifications" to change the ringtone. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. Find and tap the icon on your home screen to open your Settings menu. As of May 5, 2025, WhatsApp is only supported on iOS 15.1 and later. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Sounds & Haptics in Settings.
steps.content: Tap Sounds & Haptics in Settings. This option is listed next to a white speaker icon in a red square. It will open your ringtone and vibration settings.

steps.title: Tap the Ringtone box.
steps.content: Tap the Ringtone box. You can find it under the "SOUNDS AND VIBRATION PATTERNS" heading. This will change your ringtone for all WhatsApp and other calls via your mobile carrier. You can't change your WhatsApp calling ringtone without changing it for all mobile calls.

steps.title: Select the ringtone you want to use.
steps.content: Select the ringtone you want to use. Tap any ringtone on the list to hear a preview. You'll see a blue checkmark next to the ringtone you select.

steps.title: Tap the blue Back icon on the top-left.
steps.content: Tap the blue Back icon on the top-left. This will take you back to the Sounds menu, and save your new ringtone. This will change your ringtone for all incoming calls, including WhatsApp calls and calls via your mobile carrier.

steps.title: Open WhatsApp Messenger on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp Messenger on your iPhone. The WhatsApp icon looks like a white telephone in a green speech balloon. You can find it on your home screen or in an app folder. As of May 5, 2025, WhatsApp is only supported on iOS 15.1 and later. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Settings tab on the bottom-right.
steps.content: Tap the Settings tab on the bottom-right. This button looks like a gray gear icon on a navigation bar at the bottom of your screen. It will open your Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Notifications.
steps.content: Tap Notifications . It's listed next to a red icon on the Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Ringtone under "WHATSAPP CALLING.
steps.content: Tap Ringtone under "WHATSAPP CALLING. " This option is at the bottom of the Notifications page. It will open a list of the available ringtones. This option may not be available on newer versions of WhatsApp. With the latest updates, WhatsApp doesn't allow setting a custom ringtone for voice calls anymore, although you can still change your message and group notifications.

steps.title: Select the ringtone you want to use.
steps.content: Select the ringtone you want to use. You can tap any ringtone on the list, and hear a preview of it.

steps.title: Tap Save on the top-right.
steps.content: Tap Save on the top-right. This is a blue button in the upper-right corner of the page. It will save your new ringtone. You will hear this tone when you receive a voice call on WhatsApp.
